tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I visited Sparsh hospital, for immediate critical care for my 8 year old son who had complaints of fever followed by tiredness, headache and eye lids pain & loss of appetite. With no delay, Dr Anil examined the child , listened to the problem and narrowed down the issue. 

My son was in the febrile stage of Dengue, He insisted on immediate IV and blood work to prevent further Dehydration & determine the actual cause. He very neatly explained the stages of Dengue & the need for constant observation to further avoid major impacts & necessary treatments. 

My son was hospitalized for 5 days, his constant observation, detailed explanation, motivational words helped us a lot to get rid of the unknown fear & timely medication helped my child recover within 6 days.

I strongly recommend Dr Anil.More than the treatment his kind nature motivates and gives a complete confidence & helps in speedy recovery.
reply_text: Thank you for your kind words and feedback.

review:
My kid had dengue and respiratory infection sir treated it well and explained about the causes and told  not to panic because it's common in kids now a days.
We were really scared because fever was very high by 3 days the fever was gone and my kid was feeling better.

Dr.Anil is been our name synonym with my kids treatment.
My elder kid and my younger kid both get checked by him.
His approach toward the treatment - no antibiotics immediately unless needed, counselling parents and hearing to their anxiety and briefing them about illness and handling it is best in his way.. a must recommended doctor.

First of all there was no appointment. When I asked them about my appointment done from Practo, they said there are no such appointment. So I had to take appointment freshly and did wait for almost an hour. 
So if any one taking appointment through you must get confirmation from concerned clinic/hospital.
Regarding doctor, it was good experience. No issue.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,
review: Dr Anil explained in detail about the Dengue Fever, the line of treatment going to be followed and the approximate time generally required for hospitalization. He is very friendly and his presence is comfortable. Our experience overall is very good. Our Best Wishes to the Doctor and his supporting staff. Thanks

What I like abt Dr Anil his kind and friendly with young children.This puts at ease the child and not be afraid of hospital visits. Also his diagnosis is **** *** ensuring right medical help ( avoiding antibiotics as immediate solution). Highly recommended

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: My son was so critical and at that time doc did their best and bought back my son to me. I could not express my feelings in words,  I feel so happy and today wen I see my son's  smile I just thank Dr Anil Kumar who came as a God in my life and saved my son. Thank u so much sir. üôèüôèüôèüôè

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
This is the third time v visited there for my kid health and vaccination matters v r very happy about the service v received there. 
And doctor is too friendly and hear our quierry with lots of patience and mean while he give super suggestions to it. 
I recommend dis doctor all the parents.
Thanks a lot doctor ur suggestions means lot to us.

Could not have chosen a better paediatrician for my baby girl. Dr. Anil has been commendable with regard to practising evidence based medicine, esp when it comes to handling pediatric allergies which are so common and unique to each baby in the present world. Has been empathetic, kind and clear with his way of practice. Dr Anil has guided us through my babies acute viral gastroenteritis and cows milk protein allergy that my daughter was diagnosed with.
Thank you.
Dr.Priyanka
Very friendly. Does not prescribe anti biotics at first instance unless unavoidable. He has been our go-to paediatrician for the past 2 years.
